tuv.seg: Travel documents for people with refugee or subsidiary protection status
Cáipéisí taistil do dhaoine le stádas dídeanaithe nó cosanta coimhdí
People who have international protection (refugee status or international protection) who are living in Ireland may apply for a travel document to allow them to travel outside Ireland

Is féidir le duine le stádas dhídeanaithe nó fochosantas iarratas a dhéanamh ar cháipéis taistil chun taisteal thar lear. Bíonn daoine a ndéantar cosanta coimhdí a cheadú dóibh incháilithe freisin chun iarratas a dhéanamh ar dhoiciméad taistil
You can find information about travel documents on the website of the Irish Naturalisation and Immigration Service
Is féidir leat teacht ar fhaisnéis faoi dhoiciméid taistil ar láithreán gréasáin Sheirbhís Eadóirdseachta agus Inimirce na hÉireann
You are eligible to apply to the Minister for Justice and Equality for a travel document if you:
Tá tú i dteideal iarratas a dhéanamh leis an Aire Dlí, Cirt agus Comhionannais le haghaidh doiciméad taistil:
• Have been granted refugee status in accordance with the Geneva Convention of 1951
• Má bronnadh ort stádas dídeanaí i gcomhréir le Coinbhinsiún na Ginéive, 1951
• Are a family member of a person with refugee status who has been granted family reunification
• Más ball teaghlaigh thú ina bhfuil duine ag a bhfuil stádas dídeanaí ar ar bronnadh athaontú teaghlaigh
• Have been declared stateless in accordance with the New York Convention of 1954
• Má dearbhaíodh gur duine gan stát thú i gcomhréir le Coinbhinsiún na Ginéive, 1954
• Have been granted subsidiary protection
• Má ceadaíodh cosaint choimhdeach duit
(Family members who have been granted permission to remain in Ireland as a result are also eligible to apply for a travel document)
(Tá baill teaghlaigh nár tugadh cead dóibh fanacht in Éirinn mar thoradh air seo i dteideal, freisin, iarratas a dhéanamh ar dhoiciméad taistil)
• Have been declared a Programme refugee in accordance with section 24 of the Refugee Act 1996 as amended
• Má dearbhaíodh gur dídeanaí Cláir thú i gcomhréir le halt 24 d’Acht na nDídeanaithe, 1996 (arna leasú)
If you have refugee status or subsidiary protection, you may travel freely in and out of the state with this document
Féadann tú taisteal saor ó bhac laistigh agus lasmuigh den stát leis an gcáipéis seo
You may travel to most EU states with this document without the need to obtain a visa
Is féidir leat taisteal chuig mórchuid de bhallstáit an AE leis an gcáipéis seo gan víosa a fháil
However, some countries require a visa, so it is always advisable to check with the embassy of whichever country you intend travelling to about visa requirements
Teastaíonn víosa ó roinnt tíortha, áfach, mar sin moltar duit seiceáil le hambasáid pé tír a bhfuil sé i gceist agat taisteal chuici i dtaobh riachtanais víosa
You do not require a re-entry visa to come back into Ireland
Ní theastaíonn víosa athiontrála uait chun filleadh ar Éirinn
Your children need their own travel document
Teastaíonn a ndoiciméad féin taistil ó do leanaí
An application for a child must be accompanied by the child’s birth certificate and evidence that the child is resident in Ireland
Ní mór go ngabhfaidh teastas breithe an linbh mar aon le fianaise go bhfuil cónaí in Éirinn ar an leanbh le hiarratas le haghaidh linbh
Travel documents for children aged from 5 to 17 years are valid for up to 10 years
Tá doiciméid taistil do leanaí d’aois 5-17 mbliana bailí ar feadh a mhéid agus 10 mbliana
A travel document for a child aged under 5 is valid for up to 5 years
Tá doiciméid taistil do leanbh faoi 5 bliana d’aois bailí ar feadh a mhéid agus 5 bliana
If you have do not have refugee status or subsidiary protection but have been granted permission to remain in Ireland, you should apply for a passport to the embassy of your country
Mura bhfuil stádas dídeanaithe nó fochosanta agat ach gur bronnadh cead fanachta in Éirinn ort, ba chóir duit iarratas ar phas a dhéanamh chuig ambasáid do thíre
In some exceptional cases people who have been granted permission to remain and who do not have a passport, may be issued with an alternative travel document by the Minister for Justice and Equality
I gcásanna eisceachtúla áirithe a bhaineann le daoine ar ceadaíodh dóibh fanacht agus nach bhfuil pas acu, d’fhéadfadh an tAire Dlí agus Cirt agus Comhionannais doiciméad taistil malartach a eisiúint
If you are issued with an alternative travel document, it will be valid until the expiry date of your Certificate of Registration (GNIB card)
Má eisítear doiciméad taistil malartach duit, beidh sé bailí suas go dtí dáta éaga do Theastas Inimirce de Chlárú (cárta BNGSI)
You must obtain a re-entry visa before you leave the State otherwise you may have difficulties re-entering
Caithfidh tú víosa athiontrála a fháil sula bhfágann tú an Stát nó b’fhéidir go mbeidh deacrachtaí agat agus tú ag iarraidh ath-iontráil
You also need a visa to enter other EU countries
Teastaíonn víosa uait chomh maith chun dul isteach i dtíortha eile an AE
The application fee for a travel document is €80
Is €80 táille iarrataís ar cháipéis taistil
A single entry visa costs €60 and a multiple entry visa costs €100
Cosnaíonn víosa aon-iontrála €60 agus tá €100 ar víosa il-iontrála
You apply to the Travel Document Unit of INIS using the travel document application form (pdf) - see 'Where to apply' below

Ba chóir duit iarratas a dhéanamh ar an tAonad Seirbhísí Dhoiciméid Taistil don Seirbhís Eadóirseach (SEIÉ) ag baint úsáide duit as an leagan den iarrtais ar cháipéis tastil (pdf) - féach 'Cá háit a dhéanfaidh mé iarratas' thíos
You should include the following with your completed application:
Ba chóir duit na nithe a leanas a chur san áireamh leis an iarratas comhlánaithe:
• Four passport-sized photographs - check the photographic requirements for a travel document (pdf)
• Ceithre ghrianghraf pas - ba cheart duit na riachtanais maidir le grianghraif le haghaidh cáipéis taistil a sheiceáil (pdf)
• Fee of €80 - you should pay by bank draft or postal order, made payable to the Department of Justice and Equality
• Táille €80 - ba chóir duit íocaíocht a dhéanamh trí dhréacht bainc nó ordú poist, iníoctha leis an Roinn Dlí agus Cirt agus Comhionannais
• A copy of your Certificate of Registration, also known as your GNIB card
• Cóip de Deimhniú Clárúcháin, nó Cárta BNGSI mar a thugtar air freisin
A member of the Garda Síochána must sign and stamp 2 of the photographs when witnessing your form
Ní mór do bhall den Gharda Síochána dhá cheann de na grianghraif a shíniú agus a stampáil agus an ball sin ina f(h)inné ort agus an fhoirm á comhlíonadh agat
It will take 4-6 weeks to process your application and your travel document will be sent to you by registered post
Glacfaidh sé idir 4 agus 6 seachtaine le d’iarratas a phróiseáil agus seolfar do dhoiciméid taistil chugat tríd an bpost cláraithe
If your application is refused you will be informed in writing
Má dhiúltaítear do d’iarratas, cuirfear ar an eolas thú i scríbhinn
You are advised not to make any travel arrangements until you receive your travel document
Ní mholtar duit aon socruithe taistil a dhéanamh go dtí go bhfaigheann tú do dhoiciméid taistil
Re-entry visas: Before making any travel arrangements you must apply for a re-entry visa using the re-entry visa application form
Víosaí athiontrála: Sula ndéanfaidh tú socrú taistil ar bith, ní mór duit iarratas a dhéanamh le hOifig Víosaí SEIÉ ag baint úsáide duit as an bhfoirm iarratais ar víosa athiontrála
You should check the INIS website for information on how to apply and current processing times
Tá faisnéis ar an suíomh SEIÉ maidir le conas iarratas a dhéanamh agus na tréimhsí phróiseála reatha
